Content: Archeological excavations in Ampara, Rajagala-tenna have found many items belonging to the middle Stone Age. The excavations have been done jointly by the Sri Jayawardenapura University, Archeology Department and India’s Decan University. At the initial excavations in 2016 several equipment including stone weapons were found. Dr. Gamini Ranasinghe of the Archeology Department of the Sri Jayawardenapura University said that human teeth, animal bones and equipment of Archeological value were found this time.
